Reference is made to your letter of August 20, 1956 requesting information
about membership in the Association for Education by Radio-TV.
Recent action taken by the mersiberships of the AERT and the National Associa¬
tion of Educational Broadcasters has resulted in a merger of the two organi¬
zations and former members of the AERT are now classified as Individual mem¬
bers of the KAEB.
I am enclosing some descriptive material about the NAEB and we would be
pleased to have you join the Association as an individual member. For 1957
Individual dues are 45,00 for which you would receive the NAEB Journal
(formerly the AERT Journal) and the NAEB Newsletter. In addition you would
occasionally receive some of the reports, surveys, etc. that we publish.
Due to action taken by the membership at our 1956 convention Individual dues
will be raised to $7,50 per year beginning in 195S.
Under separate cover I am sending you recent issues of the Journal and the
Newsletter, plus a list of the various publications we have for sale. If
you would care to order any of these publications at the time you apply for
membership, we will be glad to fill such an initial order at one-half the
list price. This, of coiirse, depends upon the availability of the publica¬
tions and does not apply to the albums listed. This special price applies
only to the order accompanying your application for membership, and any
future sales would have to be at the full list price.
If you would care to join the? Association, will you please write a Grief
letter indicating such desie and setting forth your present position and
mailing address and enclose a check, made out to the National Association
of Educational Broadcasters, for |5*00. If you have any flirther questions
about the Association, please let me know.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
